bug.summary: kubeflow installer does not create katib/metadatadb database
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: [A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] Install fresh kubeflow 0.6.2 with fresh pv for katib-db and metadata-db. Readiness probe fails in bofh cases. What did you expect to happen: Database should be created automatically if it doesn't exist. Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): 0.6.2 kfctl version: (use kfctl version): v0.6.2-0-g47a0e4c7 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) kubernetes Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): 1.14.5 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): centos 7

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/boniek83>@boniek83</denchmark-link> yes, for katib-db, the below ENV will create katib database automatically if it doesn't exist (<denchmark-link:https://hub.docker.com/_/mysql>https://hub.docker.com/_/mysql</denchmark-link> ). Can you show me the pod logs of katib-db? how many times had the Pod restarted? <denchmark-code> - name: MYSQL_DATABASE value: "katib" </denchmark-code>

AFAIK, for some PV, docker image cannot work well anyhow. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/boniek83>@boniek83</denchmark-link> so you can also try to change image of katib-db deployment to and change value of katib-db deployment as below to try what happens. <denchmark-code> args: - --datadir - /var/lib/mysql/anotheranyname </denchmark-code>
Is your PVC bound to PV? Please provide more information

I am using <denchmark-link:https://github.com/helm/charts/tree/master/stable/nfs-client-provisioner>https://github.com/helm/charts/tree/master/stable/nfs-client-provisioner</denchmark-link> as storage provisioner on on-premises kubernetes cluster. PVC is bound to PV. mysql:8 restarted only once. It prints a lot of:
[Note] Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost' (using password: YES)
after startup (every 2-3 seconds) I can manually create database when inside of db container. Only after creating database manually, service shows active endpoint and I can telnet to katib-db at port 3306. I didn't test if connetion works with mysql client command due to errors earlier and recommendation to try mysql 5. When using mysql:5 image database brings itself up (database is created automatically) but katib-manager is not working:
[mysql] 2019/08/30 10:24:17 packets.go:36: unexpected EOF
is printed to logs and katib-manager restarts. Telnet to katib-db at port 3306 from another container works, but mysql -h katib-db -P 3306 -u root -p doesn't, command exits with error:
ERROR 2013 (HY000): Lost connection to MySQL server at 'reading initial communication packet', system error: 0
Will there be an option to specify our own mysql instance and username? Running mysql on kubernetes with root is not a good practice - no replication, no monitoring, no backups, no security.
